channel.title: Comments on: Finding SQL Server Support – Become an expert yourself
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLGal
item.dc:creator: SQLGal
item.description: Thanks for this article. I am now in the area of SQL Server and am finding it a challenging and rewarding experience. <br /> I have nothing to give back at the moment as I am still learning but as soon as I can help people you have encouraged me to do just that.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for this article. I am now in the area of SQL Server and am finding it a challenging and rewarding experience.
I have nothing to give back at the moment as I am still learning but as soon as I can help people you have encouraged me to do just that.

item.title: By: ArrgHUnter
item.dc:creator: ArrgHUnter
item.content:encoded:
Well, that is a one good article. i use forums to poast question rarely as most of the time i find my answers by simple search. but i think what i will do in future is i’ll spare some time to help the community. honestly, i wasn’t giving too much back to community. your article made my mind, to live like a family and to contribute to build the community.

thanks,

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
This is a nice list

I would probably add 2 categories to this myself

Webcast/podcast/screen cast
Because you know when you are on the go you can still get in some technical content and learn something. You can also do a lunch and learn at work and watch a webcast in the conference room with your co-workers while you eat.

Blogging
Once you start blogging you will be a better developer since in order to not get a bunch of comments telling you that your content sucks, you will want to make sure that you have researched your code and made sure that it is correct and performs well.

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Excellent Blog Ted. I am always trying to find ways to obtain help and/or provide assistance(what limited knowledge I can provide). I appreciate the categorization levels you outline. Makes a lot of sense.
item.content:encoded: Excellent Blog Ted. I am always trying to find ways to obtain help and/or provide assistance(what limited knowledge I can provide). I appreciate the categorization levels you outline. Makes a lot of sense.
